sense.gloss: to initiate action in; make active.
in chemistry, to make more reactive, as by heating.
to assign (a military unit) to active status.
in physics, to cause radioactive properties in (a substance).
to cause decomposition in (sewage) by aerating.
to combine (something) with something else, often to increase the amount or number of the latter. "I added herbs to the recipe" ; "He wants to add this stamp to his collection".
to find the total of (often fol. by up). "Add up the numbers".
to say or write beyond what has been said or written.
to perform the mathematical operation of addition.
to make the correct total or expected result (fol. by up). "His quitting doesn't add up"
to increase (fol. by to).
to come into view; become visible.
to seem. "He appears smart, but I have doubts".
to come before the public, as a book or performer.
(a variable in a logical or mathematical expression whose value determines the dependent variable; if f(x)=y, x is the independent variable)
(a discussion in which reasons are advanced for and against some proposition or proposal; "the argument over foreign aid goes on and on")
(a summary of the subject or plot of a literary work or play or movie; "the editor added the argument to the poem")
(a fact or assertion offered as evidence that something is true; "it was a strong argument that his hypothesis was true")

sense.synset: controversy contention contestation tilt argument arguing
sense.gloss: (a dispute where there is strong disagreement; "they were involved in a violent argument")
(the part of a garment that is attached at armhole and provides a cloth covering for the arm)
(instrument used in fighting or hunting; "he was licensed to carry a weapon")
(the part of an armchair or sofa that supports the elbow and forearm of a seated person)
(any projection that is thought to resemble an arm; "the arm of the record player"; "an arm of the sea"; "a branch of the sewer")
(a human limb; technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb)
(an administrative division of some larger or more complex organization; "a branch of Congress")
to put a question to. "He asked me how to do it".
to request of. "I asked him to close the window".
to demand or expect. "All I ask is a little respect".
to invite. "He asked me to the movies".
to question; inquire. "She asked about you".
to request or seek (usu. fol. by for). "He asked for some water".

(a distinctive but intangible quality surrounding a person or thing: "an air of mystery"; "the house had a neglected air"; "an atmosphere of defeat pervaded the candidate's headquarters"; "the place had an aura of romance")
(the mass of air surrounding the Earth; "there was great heat as the comet entered the atmosphere")
(the envelope of gases surrounding any celestial body)
(a unit of pressure: the pressure that will support a column of mercury 760 mm high at sea level and 0 degrees centigrade)
(the weather or climate at some place; "the atmosphere was thick with fog")
(a particular environment or surrounding influence; "there was an atmosphere of excitement")
(a conference (usually with someone important); "he had a consultation with the judge"; "he requested an audience with the king")
(a gathering of spectators or listeners at a (usually public) performance; "the audience applauded"; "someone in the audience began to cough")
(the part of the general public interested in a source of information or entertainment; "every artist needs an audience"; "the broadcast reached an audience of millions")
(an opportunity to state your case and be heard; "they condemned him without a hearing"; "he saw that he had lost his audience")
(a flight maneuver; aircraft tips laterally about its longitudinal axis (especially in turning); "the plane went into a steep bank")
(a building in which commercial banking is transacted; "the bank is on the corner of Nassau and Witherspoon")
(a container (usually with a slot in the top) for keeping money at home; "the coin bank was empty")
(a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities; "he cashed a check at the bank"; "that bank holds the mortgage on my home")
(an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers; "he operated a bank of switches")
(a long ridge or pile; "a huge bank of earth")
(sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water); "they pulled the canoe up on the bank"; "he sat on the bank of the river and watched the currents")
(a slope in the turn of a road or track; the outside is higher than the inside in order to reduce the effects of centrifugal force)
(a supply or stock held in reserve for future use (especially in emergencies))
(the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games; "he tried to break the bank at Monte Carlo")
to perform the first step in a process; start.
to come into being.

sense.synset: begin commence kick_off lead open set_about start
sense.gloss: to perform the first step of (something); start.
to cause to come into being.
to move upward; go towards the top; ascend.
to slope upward.
to twist around and up a tall support. "The ivy climbed to the balcony".
to strive to become more important, wealthier, or more successful, or to become so.
to go up; ascend. "Let's climb the hill".

sense.synset: decide conclude determine negotiate resolve settle solve
sense.gloss: to arrive at a conclusion about or a settlement of. "We decided our dispute".

sense.synset: decide conclude determine finish resolve terminate
sense.gloss: to bring to a definite end. "The game was decided by a shot in the final second".
to make up one's mind about something; resolve to do something.
to resolve a conflict or dispute.
(a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality: "a moderate degree of intelligence"; "a high level of care is required"; "it is all a matter of degree")
(the seriousness of something (e.g., a burn or crime); "murder in the second degree"; "a second degree burn")
(the highest power of a term or variable)
(an award conferred by a college or university signifying that the recipient has satisfactorily completed a course of study; "he earned his degree at Princeton summa cum laude")
(a measure for arcs and angles; "there are 360 degrees in a circle")
(a unit of temperature on a specified scale; "the game was played in spite of the 40-degree temperature")
(a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process; "a remarkable degree of frankness"; "at what stage are the social sciences?")
(the quality of being unlike or dissimilar: "there are many differences between jazz and rock")
(a disagreement or argument about something important; "he had a dispute with his wife"; "there were irreconcilable differences"; "the familiar conflict between Republicans and Democrats")
(a variation that deviates from the standard or norm; "the deviation from the mean")
(the number that remains after subtraction; the number that when added to the subtrahend gives the minuend)
(a significant change; "the difference in her is amazing"; "his support made a real difference")

(unlike in nature or quality or form or degree; "took different approaches to the problem"; "came to a different conclusion"; "different parts of the country"; "on different sides of the issue"; "this meeting was different from the earlier one")
(not like; marked by dissimilarity; "for twins they are very unlike"; "people are profoundly different")
(distinctly separate from the first; "that's another (or different) issue altogether")
(differing from all others; not ordinary; "advertising that strives continually to be different"; "this new music is certainly different but I don't really like it")
(distinct or separate; "each interviewed different members of the community")
(an effort that is inconvenient; "I went to a lot of trouble"; "he won without any trouble"; "had difficulty walking"; "finished the test only with great difficulty")
(the quality of being difficult; "they agreed about the difficulty of the climb")
(a factor causing trouble in achieving a positive result or tending to produce a negative result; "serious difficulties were encountered in obtaining a pure reagent")
(a situation or condition almost beyond one's ability to deal with and requiring great effort to bear or overcome: "grappling with financial difficulties")
(a thin flat circular plate)

sense.synset: phonograph_record phonograph_recording record disk disc platter
sense.gloss: (sound recording consisting of a disc with continuous grooves; formerly used to reproduce music by rotating while a phonograph needle tracked in the grooves)
((computer science) a memory device consisting of a flat disk covered with a magnetic coating on which information is stored)
(something with a round shape like a flat circular plate)
to consume (food) through the mouth.
to destroy through wearing away; corrode. "Rust eats metal".
to ravage or consume in the manner of eating. "a budget that was eaten by unexpected expenses".
to bother or disturb. "What's eating them"?
(informal) to bear the cost of. "He had to eat the unpaid bills".
to partake of food.
to corrode. "Rust ate through the metal".
to meet or come upon, esp. suddenly or by chance.
to meet or confront in battle or conflict.
to meet with, or come up against, esp. unexpectedly. "I encountered some unforeseen difficulties".
to meet, esp. in conflict or unexpectedly.
to hope for or look forward to with some reason to believe in fulfillment. "I expect him at noon"; "I expect success".
(informal) to guess or suppose. "I expect you would like a drink of water after such hard exercise".
to be pregnant. "She is expecting".
to make (ideas, thoughts, or feelings) known by saying or writing, or by creating art works.
to make known the thoughts or feelings of (oneself).
to send by rapid transport.
to show or make manifest.
to perceive with the ears.
to be informed about; learn. "I heard he was coming back to town".
to listen to carefully. "Did you really hear what he told you"?
to give formal audience to, esp. in a court of law. "The judge wouldn't hear our case".
to have the ability to perceive sound.
to receive information or greetings from another. "He heard from his sister yesterday".
to listen with agreement or consent (usu. fol. by of). "He would not hear of my paying the check".

(used of physical heat; having a high or higher than desirable temperature or giving off heat or feeling or causing a sensation of heat or burning; "hot stove"; "hot water"; "a hot August day"; "a hot stuffy room"; "she's hot and tired"; "a hot forehead")

(extended meanings; especially of psychological heat; marked by intensity or vehemence especially of passion or enthusiasm; "a hot temper"; "a hot topic"; "a hot new book"; "a hot love affair"; "a hot argument")
((informal) marked by excited activity; "a hot week on the stock market")
((electricity) charged or energized with electricity; "a hot wire"; "a live wire")
(having or showing great eagerness or enthusiasm; "hot for travel")
(very fast; "a blistering pace"; "got off to a hot start"; "in hot pursuit"; "a red-hot line drive")
(newly made; "a hot scent")
(very good; often used in the negative; "he's hot at math but not so hot at history")
((informal) recently stolen or smuggled; "hot merchandise"; "a hot car")
(having or bringing unusually good luck; "hot at craps"; "the dice are hot tonight")
(of a seeker; near to the object sought; "you're getting warm"; "hot on the trail")
(newest or most recent; "news hot off the press"; "red-hot information")
((informal) very popular or successful; "one of the hot young talents"; "cabbage patch dolls were hot last season")
(having a piquant burning taste of spices or peppers; "gingery Chinese food"; "hot peppers"; "hot curry"; "corn chips with peppery salsa"; "spicy tomato sauce")
(having or dealing with dangerously high levels of radioactivity; "hot fuel rods"; "a hot laboratory")
(sexually excited or exciting; "was hot for her"; "hot pants")
((informal) performed or performing with unusually great skill and daring and energy; "a hot drummer"; "he's hot tonight")
(very unpleasant or even dangerous; "make it hot for him"; "in the hot seat"; "in hot water")
(characterized by violent and forceful activity or movement; very intense; "the fighting became hot and heavy"; "a hot engagement"; "a raging battle"; "the river became a raging torrent")
(wanted by the police; "a hot suspect")
((color) bold and intense; "hot pink")
(capable of quick response and great speed; "a hot sports car")

(a visual representation of an object or scene or person produced on a surface; "they showed us the pictures of their wedding"; "a movie is a series of images projected so rapidly that the eye integrates them")
(a representation of a person (especially in the form of sculpture); "the coin bears an effigy of Lincoln"; "the emperor's tomb had his image carved in stone")
((Jungian psychology) a personal facade one presents to the world; "a public image is as fragile as Humpty Dumpty")
(an iconic mental representation; "her imagination forced images upon her too awful to contemplate")
(a standard or typical example; "he is the prototype of good breeding"; "he provided America with an image of the good father")
(language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense)
(someone who closely resembles a famous person (especially an actor); "he could be Gingrich's double"; "she's the very image of her mother")
(of great significance or value; "important people"; "the important questions of the day")
(of extreme importance; vital to the resolution of a crisis; "a crucial moment in his career"; "a crucial election"; "a crucial issue for women")
(important in effect or meaning; "a significant change in tax laws"; "a significant change in the Constitution"; "a significant contribution"; "significant details"; "statistically significant")
(having or suggesting a consciousness of high position; "recited the decree with an important air"; "took long important strides in the direction of his office")
(having authority or ascendancy or influence; "an important official"; "the captain's authoritative manner")

(a subject or pursuit that occupies one's time and thoughts (usually pleasantly): "sailing is her favorite pastime"; "his main pastime is gambling"; "he counts reading among his interests"; "they criticized the boy for his limited interests")
(a reason for wanting something done; "for your sake"; "died for the sake of his country"; "in the interest of safety"; "in the common interest")
(the power of attracting or holding one's interest (because it is unusual or exciting etc.); "they said nothing of great interest"; "primary colors can add interest to a room")
(a sense of concern with and curiosity about someone or something; "an interest in music")
((usually plural) a social group whose members control some field of activity and who have common aims; "the iron interests stepped up production")
(a fixed charge for borrowing money; usually a percentage of the amount borrowed; "how much interest do you pay on your mortgage?")
(a right or legal share of something; a financial involvement with something; "they have interests all over the world"; "a stake in the company's future")
((law) the determination by a court of competent jurisdiction on matters submitted to it)
(the act of judging or assessing a person or situation or event; "they criticized my judgment of the contestants")
(the capacity to assess situations or circumstances shrewdly and to draw sound conclusions)
(the cognitive process of reaching a decision or drawing conclusions)
(ability to make good judgments)
(an opinion formed by judging something; "he was reluctant to make his judgment known"; "she changed her mind")
(the legal document stating the reasons for a judicial decision; "opinions are usually written by a single judge")
to no longer possess; be unable to find; misplace. "I lost my overshoes".
to fail to keep possession of. "I just lost a quarter in this candy machine".
to fail to win. "They lost the contest".
to fail to maintain; be unable to keep. "He lost his health, and then his pride".
to suffer the loss of through death. "He lost his mother last week".
to fail to use or take advantage of; waste. "This argument is causing us to lose time".
to go astray from. "I lost my way".
to experience defeat or loss.
to diminish the effectiveness in a particular way. "The tale loses in retelling".
to have as a goal or purpose; intend. "I mean to leave soon".
to intend to denote or express. "What I mean is that we are mortal".
of words, to signify. "The word "tomorrow" means the next day".
to intend for a particular purpose or end. "He was meant for the priesthood".
to cause as a result. "The fire means we are unlikely to return".
to have a specified degree of significance or importance. "She means little to them".
to have intentions or be disposed. "He means well, even though his acts don't show it".
to fail to hit, catch, reach, cross, or in any way touch or contact (a particular object). "He missed the ball" ; "I missed the plane".
to fail to see, hear, understand, or otherwise acknowledge. "He misses the point".
to fail to perform, attend, or otherwise experience. "I missed the concert".
to fail to achieve or attain. "They missed a good chance".
to avoid, escape, or evade. "The car missed the tree".
to feel sad or lonely in the absence of. "She missed her friend".
to fail to hit, catch, or otherwise touch something such as a target, ball, or other object.
to fail; not succeed.
to perceive or observe attentively.
to make a written record or reminder of.
to mention; remark. "She noted that she liked the wallpaper".
to function in a correct or effective manner, as a machine.
to be in the process of action; carry on affairs.
to perform a surgical procedure (usu. fol. by on).
(informal) to act with skillful deception so as to improve one's own situation.
to control the functioning of a machine or the like.
(the act of organizing a business or business-related activity; "he was brought in to supervise the organization of a new department")
(the activity or result of distributing or disposing persons or things properly or methodically; "in this new organization the container is much smaller")
(the act of forming something; "the constitution of a PTA group"; "he still remembers the establishment of the hospital")

(an ordered manner; orderliness by virtue of being methodical and well organized; "his compulsive organization was not an endearing quality"; "we can't do it unless we establish some system around here")

(an organized structure for arranging or classifying; "he changed the arrangement of the topics"; "the facts were familiar but it was in the organization of them that he was original"; "he tried to understand their system of classification")
(a group of people who work together)

sense.synset: administration governance establishment brass organization organisation
sense.gloss: (the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a governing body and who administer something; "he claims that the present administration is corrupt"; "the governance of an association is responsible to its members"; "he quickly became recognized as a member of the establishment")
(a newspaper as a physical object: "when it began to rain he covered his head with a newspaper")
(medium for written communication; "the notion of an office running without paper is absurd")
(an essay (especially one written as an assignment); "he got an A on his composition")
(a scholarly article describing the results of observations or stating hypotheses; "he has written many scientific papers")
(a daily or weekly publication on folded sheets; contains news and articles and advertisements; "he read his newspaper at breakfast")
(a business firm that publishes newspapers; "Murdoch owns many newspapers")
(a material made of cellulose pulp derived mainly from wood or rags or certain grasses)
(an occasion on which people can assemble for social interaction and entertainment; "he planned a party to celebrate Bastille Day")
(a group of people gathered together for pleasure; "she joined the party after dinner")
(an organization to gain political power; "in 1992 Perot tried to organize a third party at the national level")
(a band of people associated temporarily in some activity; "they organized a party to search for food"; "the company of cooks walked into the kitchen")
(a person involved in legal proceedings; "the party of the first part")

(the act of performing; of doing something successfully; using knowledge as distinguished from merely possessing it; "they criticised his performance as mayor"; "experience generally improves performance")
(the act of presenting a play or a piece of music or other entertainment; "we congratulated him on his performance at the rehearsal"; "an inspired performance of Mozart's C minor concerto")
(any recognized accomplishment; "they admired his performance under stress"; "when Roger Maris powered four home runs in one game his performance merits awe")
(a dramatic or musical entertainment; "they listened to ten different performances"; "the play ran for 100 performances"; "the frequent performances of the symphony testify to its popularity")

(process or manner of functioning or operating; "the power of its engine determine its operation"; "the plane's operation in high winds"; "they compared the cooking performance of each oven"; "the jet's performance conformed to high standards")
(scale drawing of a structure; "the plans for City Hall were on file")
(a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished; "they drew up a six-step plan"; "they discussed plans for a new bond issue")
(an arrangement scheme; "the awkward design of the keyboard made operation difficult"; "it was an excellent design for living"; "a plan for seating guests")

sense.synset: play act enact perform personate portray
sense.gloss: to act the part of in a drama. "He played Falstaff".
to act (a role) in real life. "She is playing the injured wife".
to perform in (a place or places). "Our band played the midwest".
to take part in (a game or contest). "Let's play soccer".
to make music with (an instrument).
to manipulate for one's advantage (usu. fol. by off). "She played off her husband against her father".
to control (a hooked fish).
to engage in recreation; have fun.
to engage in a sport or game
to behave in a specified way. "He doesn't play fair".
to make music with an instrument.
to make a toy of another; use another without due regard for his or her feelings. "He is simply playing with me".
to bring into being; yield.
to manufacture.
to give birth to.
to bring forward into view or notice; present. "His reluctance to produce his partner's name".
to organize and present (a film, play, concert, or the like) for public entertainment.
to cause, create, or yield results, esp. the usual or expected results. "The artist couldn't produce without encouragement".
to supply; furnish. "I'll provide them with food".
to make available for use; afford. "The group provides an important service".
to arrange or specify beforehand. "This law provides that speeders will be fined".
to take precautionary action (usu. fol. by for or against). "The village provided for a harsh winter".
to supply necessities such as money (often fol. by for). "She provides for her children".
to make an arrangement, agreement, or condition. "The system provides for free medical care".
to get or take (something) that has been sent or offered.
to accept (something) that has been bestowed. "He received his degree last year".
to welcome. "They receive guests often" ; "We received him as a club member".
to undergo; experience. "She received a serious injury".
to find out about. "We received the news too late".
to accept or get something.
to extend hospitality to guests.
to pick up signals, as on a radio or television.
in football, to play in the position of one designated to catch a forward pass.

sense.synset: remain abide dwell continue last persist stay
sense.gloss: to continue without a change in quality or state.
to stay or be left in the same place after others have gone.
to be left, as still to be done. "Who will win remains to be seen".
to exert authority over; govern. "He rules the country".
to have superiority over, within a particular field or area. "She rules the field in racing".
to make evenly spaced parallel lines on (a piece of paper or other surface).
to make a specific decision or ruling, as in a court of law.
to be pervasive or dominant. "Chaos rules".
(a structure that provides privacy and protection from danger)
(protective covering that provides protection from the weather)
(a way of organizing business to reduce the taxes it must pay)
(the condition of being protected; "they were huddled together for protection"; "he enjoyed a sense of peace and protection in his new home")
((botany) of leaf shapes; of leaves having no divisions or subdivisions)
(having few parts; not complex or complicated or involved; "a simple problem"; "simple mechanisms"; "a simple design"; "a simple substance")
(easy and not involved or complicated; "an elementary problem in statistics"; "elementary, my dear Watson"; "a simple game"; "found an uncomplicated solution to the problem")
(exhibiting childlike simplicity and credulity; "childlike trust"; "dewey-eyed innocence"; "simple courtesy")
(not elaborate in style; unornamented; "a simple country schoolhouse"; "her black dress--simple to austerity")
(lacking mental capacity and devoid of subtlety)
(apart from anything else; without additions or modifications; "only the bare facts"; "shocked by the mere idea"; "the simple passage of time was enough"; "the simple truth")
to perceive the odor of by means of the nose.
to examine by using the sense of smell. "She smelled the soup to see if it was ready".
to detect; discern. "We smelled dishonesty in his conduct".
to have or give off an odor or fragrance.
to have or give off an unpleasant odor; stink.
to have a lingering trace (usu. fol. by of). "The room smelled of smoke".
to investigate (usu. fol. by about or around). "Let's smell around for some evidence".
(of definite shape and volume; firm; neither liquid nor gaseous; "ice is water in the solid state")
(entirely of one substance with no holes inside; "solid silver"; "a solid block of wood")
(having three dimensions; "a solid object")
(turned into or covered with thick ice; "a brook frozen solid")
(of good substantial quality; "solid comfort"; "a solid base hit")
(not soft or yielding to pressure; "a firm mattress"; "the snow was firm underfoot"; "solid ground")
(of one substance or character throughout; "solid gold"; "a solid color"; "carved out of solid rock")
(having high moral qualities; "a noble spirit"; "a solid citizen"; "an upstanding man"; "a worthy successor")
(incapable of being seen through; "solid blackness")
(entirely of a single color throughout; "a solid fabric")
(of good quality and condition; solidly built; "a solid foundation"; "several substantial timber buildings")
(uninterrupted in space; having no gaps or breaks; "a solid line across the page"; "solid sheets of water")
(acting together as a single undiversified whole; "a solid voting bloc")
(providing abundant nourishment; "a hearty meal"; "good solid food"; "ate a substantial breakfast")
(an approximate definition or example; "she wore a sort of magenta dress"; "she served a creamy sort of dessert thing")
(a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality; "sculpture is a form of art"; "what kinds of desserts are there?")
(a person of a particular character or nature; "what sort of person is he?"; "he's a good sort")
(an operation that segregates items into groups according to a specified criterion; "the bottleneck in mail delivery it the process of sorting")
(a facility where something is available)
(anything that provides inspiration for later work)
(a document (or organization) from which information is obtained; "the reporter had two sources for the story")
(a publication (or a passage from a publication) that is referred to; "he carried an armful of references back to his desk"; "he spent hours looking for the source of that quotation")

(the place where something begins, where it springs into being; "the Italian beginning of the Renaissance"; "Jupiter was the origin of the radiation"; "Pittsburgh is the source of the Ohio River"; "communism's Russian root")
(someone who originates or causes or initiates something; "he was the generator of several complaints")
(a person who supplies information)
to hang (something) from a higher position.
to cause to stop for a period of time. "The game was suspended until they cleared the floor".
to put off till later; defer. "We will suspend judgment on the case".
to cause to be temporarily ineffective. "Can we suspend the usual rules"?
to exclude for disciplinary reasons. "The principal suspended John from school for fighting".
to cause to remain motionless, undissolved, or unattached in a fluid medium such as air or water.
to cease activity for a period of time.
to communicate through spoken words; discuss. "We talked about literary theory" ; "Can the baby talk yet"?
to gossip. "The whole town is talking".
to chatter idly or incessantly.
to give a speech; lecture.
to disclose confidential or secret information. "Even under torture he refused to talk".

sense.synset: talk articulate pronounce say speak tell utter
sense.gloss: to articulate in words.
to speak (a particular language or dialect).
to discuss. "They talked finance at the meeting".
to influence; convince. "He talked her into buying a car".
to behave toward (someone) in a particular way.
to deal with or represent in a particular way.
to discuss in speech or writing. "He treated several themes in his talk".
to relieve or cure (a disease or illness). "She treated her cold with vitamins".
to give medical attention to. "The doctor treats twenty patients a day".
to offer (food, drink, or entertainment) to at one's own expense.
to act upon in order to achieve a desired result. "He treated the wood with varnish".
to deal with a subject, topic, or theme in speech or writing (often fol. by of). "an essay that treats of politics".
to take responsibility for the cost of providing food, drink, or entertainment to another.
to bring into service; employ, esp. habitually. "I use a computer to do my homework".
to expend; consume. "He used his last dollar to buy some bread".
to employ for selfish motives; exploit. "He used his friends to get what he wanted".
to partake of (drugs). "Using heroin made him very sick".
used in the past tense in order to show a former habitual practice or state (fol. by to). "We used to go shopping every Saturday".
to make clean by immersing in or applying water or other liquid, esp. if soap is also used. "He washed all the cups".
to remove (dirt or other matter) by immersing in water or other liquid, esp. if soap is also used. "She washed the stain out of her shirt".
to transport by means of a moving liquid, esp. water. "The waves wash shells onto the beach".
to erode or destroy by the action of moving water. "Rain washed the snowman".
to make wet; moisten; drench.
to rid of guilt or impurity.
to clean or bathe oneself.
to clean something in or with water or other liquid.
to be capable of being cleaned in or with water without shrinking or fading. "This dress won't wash well".
to be carried by the action of moving water. "A pail washed up on the beach".
to be removed or worn down by the action of moving water (often fol. by away). "The paint on the road washed away in the rain".
to flow over; rush against. "The waves washed over the dock".
to look closely or with uninterrupted attention.
to look or wait in alert expectation (usu. fol. by for). "Watch for our spring sales".
to keep a vigil, esp. through the night.
to be careful or alert.
to look at closely or with uninterrupted attention.
to guard or tend attentively. "Grandmother is watching the children".
to stay informed about or aware of. "He watches the news of the world".
to be victorious in a competition.
to gain success through effort or struggle.
to gain victory in. "He won the race".

sense.synset: win achieve acquire attain earn get procure
sense.gloss: to obtain through effort. "It took years to win his freedom".
to capture in battle. "The army won the town".
to gain (loyalty, sympathy, affection, or the like). "He won her love".
to succeed in obtaining the support of. "His speech won many voters".
to form (letters, words, symbols, or characters) on a surface with a pen, pencil, typewriter, or other instrument. "Write your name on the paper".
to express or record by writing. "She wrote her ideas".
to author or compose. "She wrote that song".
to fill in the spaces of or cover with writing. "He wrote six pages".
to leave the evidence or signs of. "Guilt is written all over his face".
to form letters, words, symbols, or characters on a surface with a pen, pencil, typewriter, or other instrument.
to create written material as a job or profession. "She writes and he sells shoes"
to communicate by sending letters. "Write to me soon".
